chapter.title: Hyrule Castle - Social Script
chapter.sp: Guard 01 There's a lot going on in the castle right now. I can't allow even a dog to get into the castle!
chapter.stage: Guards are positioned within the castle such that it is impossible for Link to reach the courtyard.

chapter.title: Hyrule Castle Town - Temple of Time
chapter.stage: Near the Door of Time is a block on which words are inscribed.
chapter.sp: <game> There are three hollows and an inscription here.... Ye who owns 3 Spiritual Stones Stand with the Ocarina of Time And play the Song of Time That is how the inscription reads.
chapter.stage: As Link plays the Song of Time, the Spiritual Stones rise into the air and descend upon the hollows. An image of the Triforce placed on a wall glows with golden light, prompting the door to open.
chapter.sp: Beyond the Door of Time is a circular chamber that contains a platform on which an image of the Triforce is surrounded by images of six medallions. A sword has been driven into the platform at the Triforce's center. Navi Link, isn't that...?! It's that legendary blade...The Master Sword!!
chapter.stage: As Link grasps the sword by its hilt and pulls it from its resting place, blue light engulfs the platform.
chapter.sp: Ganondorf enters the chamber. Ganondorf Geh heh heh! Excellent work! As I thought, you held the keys to the Door of Time! You have led me to the gates of the Sacred Realm... Yes, I owe it all to you, kid!

chapter.title: Chamber of Sages
chapter.sp: Rauru Link... Wake up... Link, the chosen one...
chapter.stage: From the perspective of his eyes, Link is seen awakening in a surreal area; platforms made of water float in a room with walls of similar composition, and no apparent floor or ceiling. On the central platform are six smaller platforms that correspond to the Temple of Time's medallion images.
chapter.sp: Aside from Link and Navi, only a man named "Rauru" is present. Rauru I am Rauru, one of the ancient Sages... Ages ago, we ancient Sages built the Temple of Time to protect the entrance to the Sacred Realm... This is the Chamber of Sages, inside the Temple of Light... The Temple of Light, situated in the very center of the Sacred Realm, is the last stronghold against Ganondorf's evil forces. The Master Sword--the evil-destroying sword that you pulled out of the Pedestal of Time--was the final key to the Sacred Realm. Link... Don't be alarmed... Look at yourself...!
chapter.stage: Link's form has changed into that of a young adult.
chapter.sp: Navi Look Link! You're big now!! You've grown up! Rauru The Master Sword is a sacred blade which evil ones may never touch.... Only one worthy of the title of "Hero of Time" can pull it from the Pedestal of Time.... However, you were too young to be the Hero of Time.... Therefore, your spirit was sealed here for seven years. And now that you are old enough, the time has come for you to awaken as the Hero of Time! Well, do you understand your destiny?

choice.interact: (Yes) <see below> -
(No) Rauru Right, it looks like you are confused... Let me tell you again, from the beginning.

chapter.stage: He repeats himself from "The Master Sword is".
chapter.sp: Rauru But, remember... Though you opened the Door of Time in the name of peace... Ganondorf, the Gerudo King of Thieves, used it to enter this forbidden Sacred Realm! He obtained the Triforce from the Temple of Light, and with its power, he became the King of Evil... His evil power radiated from the temples of Hyrule, and in seven short years, it transformed Hyrule into a world of monsters. My power now has only little influence, even in this Sacred Realm... Namely, this Chamber of Sages. But there is still hope... The power of the Sages remains. When the power of all the Sages is awakened... The Sages' Seals will contain all the evil power in the void of the Realm... I, Rauru, am one of the Sages... And... Your power to fight together with the Sages makes you the Hero of Time! The Hero of Time, chosen by the Master Sword! Keep my spirit with you... And, find the power of the other Sages, and add their might to your own!
chapter.stage: A golden medallion descends from the air.
chapter.sp: <game> You received the Light Medallion! Rauru the Sage adds his power to yours!
Rauru Find the other Sages and save Hyrule!

chapter.title: Hyrule Castle Town - Temple of Time
chapter.sp: Navi Link...we're back in the Temple of Time... But have seven years really passed? It looks like you won't be able to use some of the weapons you found as a kid anymore... Let's get out of here!
chapter.stage: A person whose face is partially obscured by clothing suddenly appears near the Pedestal of Time. Link draws his sword.
chapter.sp: Sheik I've been waiting for you, Hero of Time... When evil rules all, an awakening voice from the Sacred Realm will call those destined to be Sages, who dwell in the five temples. One in a deep forest... One on a high mountain... One under a vast lake... One within the house of the dead... One inside a goddess of the sand... Together with the Hero of Time, the awakened ones will bind the evil and return the light of peace to the world... This is the legend of the temples passed down by my people, the Sheikah. I am Sheik. Survivor of the Sheikahs... As I see you standing there holding the mythical Master Sword, you really do look like the legendary Hero of Time... If you believe the legend, you have no choice. You must look for the five temples and awaken the five Sages... One Sage is waiting for the time of awakening in the Forest Temple. The Sage is a girl I am sure you know... Because of the evil power in the temple, she cannot hear the awakening call from the Sacred Realm... Unfortunately, equipped as you currently are, you cannot even enter the temple... But, if you believe what I'm saying, you should head to Kakariko Village... Do you understand, Link?
chapter.stage: When speaking to Sheik again:
chapter.sp: Sheik To save the forest girl, you need another skill... Head to Kakariko Village!
chapter.stage: Inscription on the block near the Door of Time:
chapter.sp: <game> The Ocarina of Time opened the door. The Hero of Time, with the Master Sword, descended here.

chapter.title: Building by gate
chapter.stage: This is where [002] had been. Now, a cloaked person with a stick is present.
chapter.sp: [033] Oh...you are quite an energetic young man. You're brave and handsome, too. Heh heh heh...your name is Link, isn't it. [sic] Heh heh he...don't be surprised. I can read people's minds. If I looked as good as you, I could run a different kind of business...heh he heh... My shop is the only Ghost Shop in Hyrule. Because of the great Ganondorf, it is a fine time for a business like this...heh heh heh... Oh...I can only hope the world gets even worse! The ghosts, called Poes, are spirits of concentrated hatred that appear in the fields and graveyard. They hate the world! Young man, if you catch a Poe, I will pay a lot of money for it... Heh heh hee!
chapter.stage: Subsequently:
chapter.sp: [033] Hey, young man. What's happening today? If you have a Poe, I will buy it. Your card now has 0 points. Come back again! Heh heh heh!
chapter.stage: Upon presenting a Poe:
chapter.sp: [033] Oh, you brought a Poe today! ........ Hmmm... This is a normal Poe. Here are your 10 Rupees. Take them. Heh heh. Hmmmm! Very interesting! This is a Big Poe! I'll buy it for 50 Rupees. On top of that, I'll put 100 points on your card. If you earn 1,000 points, you'll be a happy man! Heh heh.
chapter.stage: Upon earning 1,000 points:
chapter.sp: [033] Wait a minute! WOW! You have earned 1,000 points! Young man, you are a genuine Ghost Hunter! Is that what you expected me to say? Heh heh heh! Because of you, I have extra inventory of Big Poes, so this will be the last time I can buy a ghost. You're thinking about what I promised would happen when you earned 1,000 points. Heh heh. Don't worry. I didn't forget. Just take this.
chapter.stage: [033] provides an Empty Bottle.

chapter.sp: [033] Hey, young man. What's happening today? If you have a Poe, I will buy it. Your card now has 1000 points. Come back again! Heh heh heh!

I bet even someone like him has had his share of troubles in the past... [CT-011] Look at him...the man with the beard. I think he was fired from his job at the ranch... He's always just lazing around, morning, noon and night. He's an awfully carefree guy during such hard times... Talon : Z Z Z... Malon...doing all right... Mumble...mumble... Sorry to make you worry... Refer to 03'06 for additional script from Talon. The House of Skulltula's residents' scripts have not changed. [CT-023] has set up his Potion Shop in the building where Ichiro had been present. [CT-023] ^ An old witch runs the Potion Shop behind this one. You can get to that shop through the door to the left of the counter. [CT-025] has set up his Bazaar in the building here [KA-019] had been present. [CT-025] ^ We moved here from the castle town. I know times are tough, but I hope you will be a steady customer for us! Potion Shop: Granny I heard that the Lost Woods, where fairies live, is a strange place with many mysterious smells. I wish I could just once make medicine with some of the strange things I might find there... I may not be able to see very well anymore, but my nose still works fine! Hehehe! Windmill: [KA-020] appears enraged. [KA-020] Grrrrrrrrr! I'll never forget what happened on that day, seven years ago! Grrrrrrrrr! It's all that Ocarina kid's fault! Next time he comes here, I'm gonna mess him up! Though a certain event can be performed with [KA-020] now, it is transcribed in 02'22 so as to coincide with related happenings. The building on which the carpenters had been working has been completed. [CT-020] has set up his Shooting Gallery in the building. [CT-020]'s script has not changed, save that he provides a quiver upgrade (once the Fairy Bow is acquired) in return for a perfect game. [ Graveyard ] [021] is no longer present. Sign 01 Heart-Pounding Gravedigging Tour! Tours are cancelled until a new gravekeeper is found. We apologize for any inconvenience. Inside Damp's hut: Diary The gravekeeper's diary is here. Do you want to read it? (Yes) Whoever reads this, please enter my grave. I will let you have my stretching, shrinking keepsake. I'm waiting for you. --Damp - (No) You decide not to read it...
Social Script - Nighttime [ Outside ] [CT-013] and [CT-014] are still dancing. [CT-018] If I fall asleep up here, I'll surely fall down... [ Buildings ] Impa's house: [KA-008] Please don't tease my Cuccos! [KA-009] If that lady asks you about chickens, you should listen to her. [CT-004] : Nobody believes what I've been telling them all these past seven years! The scripts of Talon, [KA-010], and [CT-011] have not changed. [CT-003] Wah hah hah hah hah hah! Those are some funny-looking clothes, man! [CT-006] Folks around here tell of a fabulously rich family that once lived in one of the houses in this village... But they say that the entire family was cursed due to their greed! Who knows what might happen to those who are consumed by greed... [CT-015] The lady here is really generous. She even took care of the carpenters when they were here! Note 01 : Medicine Shop Closed until morning Note 02 : Bazaar Open only during the day Note 03 : Shooting Gallery Open only during the day
Graveyard - Damp's grave Damp Heh heh heh, young man! Are you fast on your feet? I may not look like it, but I'm confident in my speed! Let's have a race! Follow me if you dare! After having raced him through the grave: Damp The time of this race was <"">!! Hehehe, young man... You were very quick to be able to keep up with me! Hehehe! As a reward, I'm going to give you my treasure. It's called the Hookshot! Its spring-loaded chain will pull you to any spot where its hook sticks. Doesn't that sound cool? I'm sure it will help you! I live here now, so come back again sometime. I'll give you something cool! One more thing! Be careful on your way back! Heheheh... A treasure chest appears. <game> You found the Hookshot! It's a spring-loaded chain that you can cast out to hook things. You can use it to drag distant items toward you, or you can use it to pull yourself toward something. While holding {C}, you can aim with {Control Stick}. Shoot it by releasing {C}. A passage in the final room leads to the windmill.

act.title: Lon Lon Ranch
act.chapter: Part 01 Malon is in the stable during the day. Malon Oh...a visitor! It's been a long time since we've had a visitor here... Where did you come from? Since Ganondorf came, people in the Castle Town have gone, places have been ruined, and monsters are wandering everywhere. Mr. Ingo is just using the ranch to gain Ganondorf's favor... Everyone seems to be turning evil... But Dad... He was kicked out of the ranch by Mr. Ingo... If I disobey Mr. Ingo, he will treat the horses so badly... So... There's nothing I can do... At night, she sings Epona's Song in the horses' corral. Malon Please keep it a secret from Mr. Ingo that I sing this song... At night, Ingo sleeps in the house's bedroom. Ingo Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z... S-stop that song...I...I... Mumble... mumble... During the day, Ingo stands outside of the corral. Ingo There are some people in Kakariko spreading rumors that I cheated Talon out of the ranch, but... Don't be ridiculous! That guy Talon was weak! I, the hard-working Ingo, poured so much energy into this place! I don't want any strangers like you saying anything bad about me! Listen. The great Ganondorf recognized my obvious talents and gave the ranch to me! I will raise a fine horse and win recognition from the great Ganondorf! Say, young man, do you want to ride one of my fine horses? Pay me 10 Rupees and you can ride. (Ride) Ingo Do you want to hear how to ride? -(Listen) Ingo Approach the horse quietly and stand by its side. Press {A} to mount up. Use the {Control Stick} to make it run. Once it starts running, press {A} to tap it with the whip. It will speed up! When you want to jump over a fence, accelerate and hit it head on! If you try to jump over a fence at an angle, the horse won't like it, and it won't jump. After the horse comes to a complete stop, press {A} to dismount. Now, have fun! Thank you so much. Heh heh! -(Don't listen) Ingo Thank you so much. Heh heh! (Don't ride) Ingo All right then, scram ya little punk! While in the corral, when speaking to Ingo while on foot: Ingo If you use {Z} Targeting, you can talk to me from horseback. Are you ready to go home so soon? (No, I want to ride.) Ingo Tsk tsk...When your time is up, I'll kick you out of here. (Yes, I'm done.) The session concludes. When speaking to Ingo while riding a horse: Ingo When you want to dismount, stop and press {A}. Hey young man! Do I know you? I just felt as though I've seen you somewhere before... He recites the script that is used for speaking to him while on foot. Once one minute has passed: Ingo Hey! Time's up, young man! You only paid 10 Rupees! You've played around long enough! When speaking to Ingo while riding a horse, on the second and subsequent visits to the corral: Ingo You're getting better! How about a little race with me? One lap around the corral with that horse. Let's make a little wager, say 50 Rupees? (Do it) If Link's funds are insufficient, then Ingo says the same thing as when "Don't do it" is selected. If the funds are adequate, then the race begins. (Don't do it) Ingo Hey hey... What's the matter? Don't you have even 50 Rupees?! I don't want to race with someone so poor! Upon losing the race: Ingo Hee hee hee... Too bad for you! I get your 50 Rupees. Heh heh... Are you mad because you lost? If you're that upset, how about another race? Bet 50 Rupees and race again? "Race" and "Don't race" produce the same results are the previous agreement/refusal options. Upon winning the race, which is only possible by riding Epona, who must be called with Epona's Song: Ingo Sh-shoooot! If the great Ganondorf found out about this humiliation... Hey, you!! How about another race! If you win... You can keep...the horse!! Upon losing the second race: Ingo Wah ha hah! You're just a kid, after all! Well, come back any time and we'll have some more fun... He repeats the "Are you mad" script.* - Upon winning the second race: Ingo What's up with that horse?! Is that Epona? How did you tame that wild horse right under my nose?! I was going to present that horse to the great Ganondorf... But I bet it on the race and lost! Shooot! Hah ha hah! As I promised, I'll give the horse to you... However... I'll never let you leave this ranch! He closes a gate. Epona can leap some of the ranch's outer walls.

Part 02 Ingo is outside. Ingo Hi there, how are you? I am Ingo. I feel so honored to be allowed to work here. Malon is outside. Malon {1} Thank you very much for the other day... I haven't even asked you your name yet... ........ Really? Link! That's what I thought! You're the fairy boy from the forest! That was years ago! Do you remember me? You do? I was sure it was you because Epona remembered you! Oh, I have to tell you about Mr. Ingo... He was afraid that the Evil King might find out that Epona had been taken away... It really upset him! But one day, all of a sudden, he went back to being a normal, nice person! Now my dad is coming back... I can't believe it, but peace is returning to this ranch! It's all because of you! I owe you so much! Thank you! Thank you, Link! {2} Epona looks great! It looks like you were able to tame her, too! How about trying your skill with Epona on an obstacle course? I'll time you for two laps. It's pretty challenging. If you miss jumping a fence in the proper order, you'll fail. How about it? Do you want to try?
"Don't do it" does not prompt any additional script. "Let's go" prompts: The current record is 50 seconds. First, try to beat this record! If you can beat the record, I'll give you a present! Give it your best shot, OK? All right, let's get started! You failed! You have to jump over all the fences! Are you making sure to approach the fences head on? If you approach at an angle, the horse won't jump! If you want to try again, mount Epona and get ready! One more lap! Wow! Great! Your time was <"">! You and Epona make a great team! You did it! <""> is the new course record! I have to give you a present to commemorate your new record! The present is a little too heavy to give to you here, so I'll have it delivered to your house. Bet you can't wait to see it! Hee hee!
Secondary and subsequent attempts, after agreeing to try the challenge, without having beat the initial record: The record so far is <> seconds. Your best time is <"">. If you can beat the record, I'll give you a present. Give it your best shot, OK? Let's get going!
Secondary and subsequent attempts, after agreeing to try the challenge, with having beat the initial record: Your best time is <"">! How fast can you go?! C'mon, let's get started!
Failing to beat new records: Well, your time was <"">. You have to train harder! Remember, you don't need to accelerate to jump over low fences, but you do need to go fast to jump the high fences!
After Talon returns (see 03'06): During the day, Malon and Ingo are outside, while Talon is in the stable. At night, Malon and Talon are outside, while Ingo sleeps in their house. Malon Mr. Ingo... He must have been tempted by evil powers. He's not really a bad person at all... Dismounted, day: How is Epona doing? If you play Epona's Song with your Ocarina, she will surely come to you. Please come back to the ranch whenever you want to train Epona! Talon I'm gonna turn over a new leaf and work real hard from now on. Ingo * - Day: Hi there, how are you? I am Ingo. I feel so honored to be allowed to work here. Night: Z Z Z Z Z Z Z Z... Mumble... It's not easy to be a working man...

act.title: Kokiri Forest
act.sp: Though Link has aged, none of the Kokiri in the forest have changed in form. * [001-006] are Kokiri whose designations hold no bearing to past script, as their only unique visual aspect had been their locations. * [007-011] and [014] do apply to past script, as their positions are unchanged. * Two males are absent. Potential absentees [001], [003], [004], and [006]. * [012] and [013] are not used in this section due to the two males' absence, which renders these females' unidentifiable out of [001-006]'s females. * [008] is absent.
act.chapter:
Social Script [ Outside ] No one is outside, as monsters have appeared. [ Buildings ] Mido's house: [001] Why is that fairy following you around? You're not one of us! [002] I see. You didn't have any problems entering the forest, mister... Did the meanies out there bother you much? Before the Great Deku Tree died, you wouldn't see things like that around here... Since it's dangerous outside, I always stay inside my house. But I'm bored to death in here! Saria's house: [003] Have you been travelling around much, mister? Have you ever met a boy named Link? Mido said that the Great Deku Tree withered because that boy did something wrong to it... Only Saria defended Link--until she left. Maybe we misunderstood... House of the Know-it-All Brothers: [009] Since the Great Deku Tree withered...more meanies have been appearing in the forest... I'm scared! [010] Where's Saria? Do you know Saria, mister? That's weird... Where has Mido gone during such an emergency? [011] : An evil wind is blowing from the direction of the Forest Temple. Saria left, saying, "I have to do something about it!" The Forest Temple is located in the Sacred Forest Meadow in the far side of the Lost Woods. House of Twins: [004] Haven't I seen you somewhere before, mister? [005] Saria went to the Temple and hasn't come back... Kokiri Shop: [006] Hi, mister! You can't use a Deku Shield! It's only for kids! [007] You can buy arrows at a shop only if you have a bow. Have you got one, mister?
[014] ^ : We sell shields, but not swords!

act.title: Lost Woods

chapter.stage: The carpenter's son is present in Area 03. For his script, refer to 03'06.
Mido is blocking a certain path in the woods.
chapter.sp: Mido What are you? Though you wear Kokirish clothing, you can't fool me! I promised Saria I would never let anybody go through here.
chapter.stage: Upon playing Saria's Song:
chapter.sp: Mido That melody?! Saria plays that song all the time! You...Do you know Saria? That song... Saria taught that song only to her friends... OK... I trust you. When I see you... I don't know why, but I remember...him...

chapter.title: Sacred Forest Meadow
chapter.stage: Sheik jumps down from a wall as Link enters Saria's prior locale.
chapter.sp: Sheik The flow of time is always cruel... Its speed seems different for each person, but no one can change it... A thing that doesn't change with time is a memory of younger days... In order to come back here again, play the Minuet of Forest.
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Minuet of Forest! <game> You have learned the Minuet of Forest! Sheik : Link... I'll see you again...
chapter.stage: Sheik throws a Deku Nut to the ground, and is no longer present by the time that its light fades.

chapter.title: Forest Temple
chapter.stage: A certain room of the temple contains several identical paintings. As Link turns to leave the room, Ganondorf seems to appear behind him, situated on a horse. However, the figure removes its mask, revealing itself to be "Evil Spirit from Beyond Phantom Ganon". It rides its horse in and out of the paintings, afterwards dismounting the horse and floating about the room.
chapter.sp: Upon defeating Phantom Ganon, it floats to a circle of purple light in the center of the room. Ganondorf Hey kid, you did quite well... It looks like you may be gaining some slight skill... But you have defeated only my phantom... When you fight the real me, it won't be so easy! What a worthless creation that ghost was! I will banish it to the gap between dimensions!!
chapter.stage: Phantom Ganon disappears. A circle of light appears, which teleports Link to the Chamber of the Sages.

act.chapter: Chamber of the Sages Saria appears before Link. Saria Thank you... Because of you, I could awaken as a Sage... I am Saria. The Sage of the Forest Temple... I always believed that you would come. Because I know you... No... You don't have to explain it to me... Because it is destiny that you and I can't live in the same world. I will stay here as the Forest Sage and help you... Now, please take this Medallion... <game> You received the Forest Medallion! Saria awakens as a Sage and adds her power to yours! Saria will always be...your friend... Link is transported to the Great Deku Tree's Meadow. Refer to 02'17; the remainder of this section concerns subsequent visits to the Lost Woods.

chapter.title: Mido's locale
chapter.sp: Mido Oh...I see... Saria won't ever come back... But...I...I made a promise to Saria... If Link came back, I would be sure to tell him that Saria had been waiting for him... Because Saria...really... liked... Hey, you. If you see him somewhere, please let him know... And also... I'm sorry for being mean to him. Tell him that, too.

act.title: Kokiri Forest

chapter.title: Great Deku Tree's Meadow
chapter.stage: A new tree is beginning to grow, having just emerged from underground. Link moves to take a closer look, and is knocked to the ground as it grows several feet in a moment.
chapter.sp: Deku Tree Hi there! I'm the Deku Tree sprout! Because you and Saria broke the curse on the Forest Temple, I can grow and flourish! Thanks a lot! Hey, have you seen your old friends? None of them recognized you with your grown-up body, did they? That's because the Kokiri never grow up! Even after seven years, they're still kids! You must be wondering why only you have grown up! Well, as you might have already guessed, you are not a Kokiri! You are actually a Hylian! I am happy to finally reveal this secret to you! Some time ago, before the King of Hyrule unified this country, there was a fierce war in our world. One day, to escape from the fires of the war, a Hylian mother and her baby boy entered this forbidden forest. The mother was gravely injured... Her only choice was to entrust the child to the Deku Tree, the guardian spirit of the forest. The Deku Tree could sense that this was a child of destiny, whose fare would affect the entire world, so he took him into the forest. After the mother passed away, the baby was raised as a Kokiri. And now, finally, the day of destiny has come! You are a Hylian, and were always bound to leave this forest. And now... You have learned your own destiny... So you know what you must do... That's right... You must save the land of Hyrule! Now, Link, break the curses on all of the Temples, and return peace to Hyrule!!

act.chapter: Social Script The Kokiri have returned to their normal positions. [ Outside ] [001] Link... I wonder if he will come back... [002] Now that the Deku Tree's sprout is growing in the Great Deku Tree's meadow, the forest has returned to normal! [003] : Teach me to do some fancy fencing! All I've ever done is tap {B} all my life! [004] : You're such a big, strong guy! I really want to be like you someday even though I'll always be small. [005] : I still think you really look like somebody I've seen before, mister. [006] : I feel like I've known you for a long time, mister! [007] : You can buy arrows at a shop only if you have a bow. Have you got one, mister? [008] is still not present. [ Buildings ] House of the Know-it-All Brothers: [009] Somehow, a fair wind has begun to blow recently. [010] I'm sure Link will return someday! [011] : Since a fairy wind started to blow, I'm sure Link will come back! House of Twins: [012] I wonder if Saria will come back... Kokiri Shop: [013] I'm sure Link will return someday! [014] ^ We sell shields, but not swords!

chapter.title: Temple of Time
chapter.sp: Sheik You destroyed the wicked creatures that haunted the temple and awakened the Sage... But there are still other Sages who need your help. In order to awaken all the other Sages, you must become even more powerful. You must travel over mountains...under water...and even through time... If you want to return to your original time, return the Master Sword to the Pedestal of Time. By doing this, you will travel back in time seven years... The time will come when you will have to return here quickly... I will teach this to you for when that time comes... The song to return you to the Temple of Light... The Prelude of Light...
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Prelude of Light! <game> You have learned the Prelude of Light! Sheik : As long as you hold the Ocarina of Time and the Master Sword, you hold time itself in your hands... Link, we shall meet again!
chapter.stage: Sheik tosses a Deku Nut to the ground, and leaves before its light fades.

act.title: Death Mountain

chapter.title: Death Mountain Trail
chapter.stage: A gigantic Goron named "Biggoron" is present near the crater's entrance.
chapter.sp: Biggoron My Brotherrrr... Opened a new storrrre... It's Medigoron's Blade Storrrrrrrre... Howeverrrrr... I am beterrrrrr at making bladesssssss, Hylian carpenterrrrrs praise me forrrrrr my skillssssss. I'm not lyinnnnng...
chapter.stage: For additional script concerning this character, see 03'06.

act.chapter: Goron City Most Gorons are absent. Medigoron is present on the second level. Medigoron I just completed a small weapon. How about it... How about buying this knife for 200 Rupees? (Buy) Nope, you don't have enough Rupees! With sufficient funds, he provides the Giant's Knife. How do you like the feel of it? After some use, the sword breaks. It looks like there is a problem with its durability... But still... How about buying this knife for 200 Rupees? (Don't buy) All right. Come back again. Also on the second level is a small Goron rolling about. Upon stopping the Goron via bombs: Goron How could you do this to me? You, you're Ganondorf's servant! Hear my name and tremble! I am Link! Hero of the Gorons! What? Your name is also Link? Then you must be the legendary Dodongo Buster and Hero, Link! My dad is Darunia... Do you remember him? Dad named me Link after you, because you're so brave! It's a cool name! I really like it! Link, you're a hero of us Gorons! I'm so glad to meet you! Please give me your autograph! Sign it "To my friend, Link of the Gorons" Oh... I guess it's not a good time to ask you for this... Please help everyone! My dad, Darunia, went to the Fire Temple. A dragon is inside! If we don't hurry up, even my dad will be eaten by the dragon!! B-b-b-boooo hooooo! <game> : You'd better try to calm him down if you can... Maybe he will calm down if you talk to him? What do you want to ask him? (About the dragon) Link A long time ago there was an evil dragon named Volvagia living in this mountain. That dragon was very scary! He ate Gorons! Using a huge hammer, the hero of the Gorons... BOOOM! Destroyed it just like that. This is a myth from long ago, but it's true! I know, because my dad is a descendant of the hero! B-b-b-boooo hooooo! (About the Gorons) If this is selected before "About the dragon", then: Link B-b-b-boooo hooooo! After the other option: Link Everybody was taken to the Fire Temple... While my dad was out... Ganondorf's followers came and took them all away! All of them will be eaten by Volvagia! Dad said that Ganondorf has revived Volvagia... As a warning to those who might oppose him, Ganondorf is going to feed them all to Volvagia! After having selected both of the options: Link Dad went to the Fire Temple all by himself to try to save everyone... Please help, Link! I'll give you this heat-resistant tunic! <game> You got a Goron Tunic! This heat-resistant tunic is adult size, so it won't fit a kid... Going to a hot place? No worry! The doors to Darunia's chamber and the Goron Shop are opened. Link Dad told me not to let anybody follow him to the temple, but... Only you, Link, can save everyone! I'm sure that the shop owner, who is hiding somewhere right now, will also help you! Now, I'll tell you about the secret passage to the Fire Temple! Try to move the statue inside Dad's room!

chapter.title: Goron City - Social Script
chapter.sp: [007] ^ Oh, no! Everybody's gone! Only I was left behind!

chapter.title: Death Mountain Crater
chapter.stage: The statue of a Goron in Darunia's chamber blocks a path to the crater. As Link crosses a partially-broken suspension bridge, Sheik jumps into the area from a higher level.
chapter.sp: Sheik It is something that grows over time... a true friendship. A feeling in the heart that becomes even stronger over time... The passion of friendship will soon blossom into a righteous power and through it, you will know which way to go... This song is dedicated to the power of the heart... Listen to the Bolero of Fire...
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Bolero of Fire! <game> You have learned the Bolero of Fire! Sheik : Link... I'll see you again...
chapter.stage: Link tries to approach Sheik, but is blocked by a wall of fire. Sheik then uses a Deku Nut to obscure vision and depart.

act.chapter: Fire Temple Link quickly encounters Darunia by the locked door to Volvagia's locale. Darunia Who's there? Is that you, Link...? Oh, it really is Link! You've grown so big since I last saw you! I want to have a man-to-man talk with you, but now's not the time. Ganondorf is causing trouble on Death Mountain again! He has revived the evil, ancient dragon Volvagia! On top of that, he is going to feed my people to that evil dragon as a warning to other races that might resist him... If that fire-breathing dragon escapes from the mountain, all of Hyrule will become a burning wasteland! I will go on ahead to try to seal up the evil dragon... I'm concerned, though, because I don't have the legendary hammer... But I have no choice. Link...I'm asking you to do this as my Sworn Brother... While I'm trying to deal with the dragon, please save my people! The prisoners' cells are in the opposite direction. I'm counting on you, Link! He enters Volvagia's chamber. The lock is reset once the door closes. The Gorons, each placed in different cells, are curled up into balls. Gorons Please...Don't...Eat me... If you eat something like me, you'll get a stomach ache! You'll be very sorry!! After opening a Goron's cage: Gorons Are you releasing me? Am I free to go? {1} I'll tell you a secret for saving me! In order to get into the room where Darunia went, you have to do something about the pillar stuck in the ceiling. Find a path that leads to a room above the ceiling right away! {2} Here's a secret for saving me! A wall that you can destroy with the Goron's "special crop" will sound different than a regular wall if you hit it with your sword. {3} I'll tell you a secret for saving me! There are switches in this temple that you have to cut to activate. But, you can also use the Goron "special crop" to do the job. {4} I'll tell you a secret for saving me! In this temple, there are doors that fall down when you try to open them. When one of these doors starts to fall, move! If you use a sample of the Goron's "special crop," you can break it... {5} Let me tell you a secret as a reward for releasing me! When you are on fire, you can put it out by swinging your sword, or by rolling forward... Did you know that? {6} Here's a tip for rescuing me! Somewhere in this temple, you're sure to meet up with some creatures that dance as they attack. Arrows won't hurt them! Looks like you might need some of the Goron's "special crop!" That's all I have to tell you! {7} I'll tell you a secret for saving me! If you find a place you can see on the map, but can't reach, try playing your Ocarina! {8} I'll tell you a secret for saving me! A door is hidden inside the statue at the entrance to this temple. But, the Goron "special crop" won't work on it... Don't you have anything stronger? {9} Oh, I see. Big Brother Darunia asked you to rescue me. I owe you big time! Please help Big Brother! The Gorons leave the temple after Link speaks to them. In the room that Darunia had entered, there is a lava-surrounded platform on which there are nine holes, each filled with lava. "Subterranean Lava Dragon Volvagia" flies in and out of the holes. Upon the enemy's defeat, its skin burns off and its skeleton falls apart. A circle of light appears, which teleports Link to the Chamber of the Sages. From Kakariko Village, [KA-007] observes the Death Mountain volcano erupt, after which the clouds around the volcano return to normal.

chapter.title: Chamber of the Sages
chapter.stage: Darunia appears before Link.
chapter.sp: Darunia Thank you, Brother! I really appreciate what you did. I thank you on behalf of the entire Goron race! You turned out to be a real man, just as I thought you would! By the way, I, the wild Darunia, turned out to be the great Sage of Fire... Isn't that funny, Brother? Well, this must be what they call destiny. Nothing has made me happier than helping you seal the evil here! Hey, Brother, take this! This is a Medallion that contains the power of the fire spirits--and my friendship.
<game> You received the Fire Medallion! Darunia awakens as a Sage and adds his power to yours!
Darunia Don't forget... Now you and I are true Brothers!

chapter.title: Goron City - Social Script
chapter.sp: Link Brother Link! Everybody has come back! Dad and you destroyed the dragon together, didn't you! When I grow up, I want to be a strong man like you, Link! [1-2, 4-6] Thank you, Link!!
chapter.stage: [003] is not present.
chapter.sp: [007] ^ Everybody has come back! It's business as usual!

chapter.stage: The domain has been frozen. King Zora is frozen in red ice; no other Zoras appear to be present.
chapter.sp: Bottled Blue Fire can be used to thaw the ice surrounding King Zora. King Zora Oh--I've come back to life! Was it you who saved me? Don't be nervous! It looks like you have a hard time breathing underwater. As an expression of my gratitude, I grant you this tunic. With this, you won't choke underwater. <game> You got a Zora Tunic! This diving suit is adult size, so it won't fit a kid. Wear it, and you won't drown underwater.
chapter.stage: Alternatively, if Link already possesses a Zora Tunic:
chapter.sp: King Zora Ohhh, I'm revived... Was it you who saved me? Don't be so nervous! I will give you a Zora Tunic as a token of my thanks. If you have this, you can... What?! You already have one? You're ready for anything, aren't you? With my heartfelt thanks...how about a KISS?! What? You don't want it?! Oh well... If you don't want my rewards, you can listen to my troubles... Princess Ruto has gone to Lake Hylia and has not come back... I'm worried...again!
chapter.stage: Regardless of having received a tunic, when speaking to him again:
chapter.sp: King Zora Oh, my dear, sweet Princess Ruto... Where has she gone? I'm so worried...
chapter.stage: The Zora Shop's entrance can also be unfrozen via Blue Fire.
chapter.sp: [008] ^ You say you want to buy a Zora Tunic? That tunic is made of the finest material, and is therefore exceedingly expensive! In fact, I'm afraid only that very rich family in Kakariko Village can afford this fine garment...

chapter.title: Zora's Fountain
chapter.stage: The fountain has not been entirely frozen, although there is snow, and icebergs float in the waters. Jabu-Jabu is absent.

sp.character: By jumping across the icebergs, Link can access

chapter.title: Ice Cavern
chapter.stage: Sheik appears after Link acquires the Iron Boots from a treasure chest.
chapter.sp: Sheik We meet again, Link... If you came here to meet the Zoras, you wasted your time... This is all there is... With one exception, the Zoras are now sealed under this thick ice sheet... I managed to rescue the Zora princess from under the ice, but...she left to head for the Water Temple... This ice is created by an evil curse... The monster in the Water Temple is the source of the curse. Unless you shut off the source, this ice will never melt.... If you have courage enough to confront the danger and save the Zoras, I will teach you the melody that leads to the temple. Time passes, people move... Like a river's flow, it never ends... A childish mind will turn to noble ambition... Young love will become deep affection... The clear water's surface reflects growth... Now listen to the Serenade of Water to reflect upon yourself....
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Serenade of Water! <game> You have learned the Serenade of Water! Sheik : Link... I'll see you again...
chapter.stage: Link tries to approach Sheik, but is unable to do so before Sheik uses a Deku Nut to escape.

chapter.title: Zora's Domain
chapter.stage: King Zora : Ah, I see... Princess Ruto went to the Water Temple...

act.title: Lake Hylia
act.stage: The lake water has almost entirely evaporated.
act.chapter: Social Script [ Outside ] Pierre is not present. Bonooru I am Bonooru, the scarecrow musical genius! I hear a song once, and I never forget it, baby! If a song was played for Bonooru in the past: Hey! Aren't you the fairy buddy I met a long time ago? Wow, you grew, dude! Well, here's your song... What? No, I never forget! You, you're the one who forgot...aren't you? If you have an Ocarina, play that song, baby! Upon taking out the ocarina: Hey, it's the Ocarina! Play that song with it, baby! Play it like that and you'll never move this scarecrow's heart, baby! OH YEAHHH!! That's it, that's the tune!! You rock!! I'm blown away! Oh, no, no! I didn't forget the song...I never forget anything! But I just feel like rewarding you, baby! ........ I have a good idea! My buddy Pierre is wandering around, so play that tune when you want to call him! I'll tell him to help you if he's nearby and hears that song, baby! Speaking to Bonooru again: Play the usual tune to call Pierre! If he's nearby, he'll come out to help you, baby! [ Lakeside Laboratory ] [002]'s script is the same as previously, until--via the Gold Scale gained from the Fishing Pond--Link dives deeper than he could in the past. [002] You may not have noticed, but I've been watching you. You dove <6/7> meters just now. You should be able to dive deeper! You may not have noticed, but I've been watching you. You touched the bottom just now. Fantastic! I'll give this to you! He provides a Piece of Heart for diving eight meters. Upon subsequent eight-meter dives Your diving is the best in the world. Why don't you dive to the bottom of Lake Hylia? [ Fishing Pond ] [003] is now wearing a hat. If the fishing pond was not visited in the past, then the first of the following paragraphs is omitted. [003] Hey, mister! I remember you! It's been a long time! How many years has it been? Seven years?! What have you been doing all this time?! You're my only customer. I'm almost out of business! Seriously! On top of that, my hair... Uh, I mean, never mind... Well, do you want to go fishing? It costs only 20 Rupees! The remainder of this script is unchanged. While fishing: [003] Oh my gosh! This fish is gigantic!! A fish this big can't even fit on the screen, and I can't weigh it accurately, but it looks like it's about <> pounds!! You'll want to keep this one, right? "Keep it" "Don't keep it" Gosh! That's a strange fish you caught there! On top of that, it weighs <> pounds! What do you want to do with it? "Keep it anyway" "I don't want it" Note This is the Hyrule Loach. After having paid to fish: [003] What do you want? (Weigh my fish.) New prizes: Red Rupee, Purple Rupee, Golden Scale. WOW! What a rare fish! This is a Hyrule Loach! For this fish, size doesn't matter. I'll give you this prize! He provides a Purple Rupee, or (assumed) the Golden Scale. Recently, the number of these fish has decreased tremendously, so I'm going to release this one. (Let's talk about something.) This is unchanged. (I want to quit.) If no fish have been caught: Passion alone won't catch you many fish. I'm serious! If at least one fish has been caught, then he says nothing. Upon catching [003]'s hat with the fishing hook: [003] What? What are you doing to me?! Hey, what are you doing? I told you not to do that! You're terrible! Seriously! Give me back my hat! (OK) You're a kind-hearted kid! But don't tell anyone about this. Seriously! (No way) Nothing more is said. Sinking Lure: <game> Wow! Is this what I think it is? Astonishing! You snagged a sinking lure! What do you want to do with it? "Use it now." "Get rid of it." [003] * - "Let's talk about something.": What? Do you want to fish with a different lure? ...Hey, what's that? What? You just picked it up? Usually, the rules says [sic] you can't use one of those. I mean, usually. But, what the heck... "Weigh my fish.": YAHOOOOOO! This is HUGE!! A new record!! This...this weighs as much as... <> pounds!! Buuuuuuuut! That sinking lure is in violation of the rules! So, no prize for you. Wah ha ha ha ha ha! Tank The biggest fish ever caught in this pond weighed <> pounds. The angler: Link (NOTE: With illegal sinking lure.)

Water Temple In a certain room: Ruto Oh...you... If I'm right...Link?! You're Link, aren't you? It's me, your fiance, Ruto! Princess of the Zoras! Link seems a touch startled. Ruto I never forgot the vows we made to each other seven years ago! You're a terrible man to have kept me waiting for these seven long years... But now is not the time to talk about love... I'm sure you've already seen it! Zora's Domain--totally frozen! A young man named Sheik saved me from under the ice... But my father and the other Zoras have not...yet... I want to save them all! I want to save Zora's Domain! You! You have to help me! This is a request from me, the woman who is going to be your wife! Link, you have to help me destroy the evil monster in the Temple, OK?! Inside the Water Temple, there are three places where you can change the water level. I'll lead the way. Follow me, quickly!! Plaques are placed throughout the temple's walls. Plaque 01 Those who wish to open the path sleeping at the bottom of the lake must play the song passed down by the Royal Family. Plaque 2-3 Those who wish to open the gate on the far heights, play the song passed down by the Royal Family. A certain room of the temple does not appear to have any walls or ceiling; the wall-like structures to which the room's two doors are attached merely stand atop mounds of sand. Between said doors, which are on opposite sides of the area, there is a dead tree. Knee-high water flows for as far as can be seen, given the fog that starkly limits vision. The second of the doors is blocked by metal bars. As Link heads away from the locked door, a being similar to himself--Dark Link--materializes by the tree. Dark Link initiates combat, during which it predicts Link's moves. Once Dark Link is defeated, the tree disappears, and the walls and ceiling emerge from the fog. In the final room, four platforms reside in a pool of water. Navi Link! Look out! That isn't normal water over there! "Giant Aquatic Amoeba: Morpha" appears. Morpha is able to control the water so as to move itself about, and also to attack, such as by forming tentacles with the water. Upon its defeat, Morpha explodes. The water rises to the ceiling through a single tentacle, spreads out, and evaporates. What remains drops to the ground and splatters, prompting a circle of light to appear. The light takes Link to:

chapter.title: Chamber of the Sages
chapter.stage: Ruto appears before Link.
chapter.sp: Ruto Link... I would have expected no less from the man I chose to be my husband. Zora's Domain and its people will eventually return to their original state. As a reward... I grant my eternal love to you. Well, that's what I want to say, but I don't think I can offer that now. I have to guard the Water Temple as the Sage of Water... And you... You're searching for the princess, Zelda? Hah! You can't hide anything from me! Princess Zelda... She's alive. I can sense it...so don't be discouraged. I can tell that nothing will stop you in your quest for justice and peace... You must take this Medallion... Take it respectfully!
<game> You received the Water Medallion! Ruto awakens as a Sage and adds her power to yours!
Ruto If you see Sheik, please give him my thanks, OK?

act.chapter: Lake Hylia Sheik is standing on a small isle. The lake's water begins to rise. Sheik As the water rises, the evil is vanishing from the lake... Link, you did it! Link is teleported to Sheik's locale. Sheik Did Ruto want to thank me? I see.... We have to return peace to Hyrule for her sake, too. Don't we? Look at that, Link... Together, you and Princess Ruto destroyed the evil monster! Once again, the lake is filled with pure water. All is as it was here. Link steps to the isle's edge and examines the lake. While he does so, Sheik observes him. Sheik walks away while Link is looking at the lake; though Link soon realizes this, Sheik first reaches the top of a nearby tree. As Link looks about, Sheik jumps off of the tree and dives into the lake.

chapter.title: Lake Hylia - Social Script
chapter.stage: On the isle, there is writing on a stone.
chapter.sp: Writing When water fills the lake, shoot for the morning light.
chapter.stage: Firing at arrow in the sun's direction causes the Fire Arrow to appear.

chapter.title: Zora's Domain
chapter.stage: Zora's Domain is still frozen, though the weather is no longer snowy. King Zora's script is unchanged.
Impa's house and the House of Skulltula have been set ablaze. Link approaches Sheik, who is standing by the well.
chapter.sp: Sheik Get back, Link!
chapter.stage: The wooden poles attached to the well are severed and tossed aside by an invisible force. Rain begins to fall.
chapter.sp: An invisible spirit emerges from the well, by which Sheik is grabbed and thrown to the ground. The spirit moves about the village, appearing as large bluish lines on the ground and walls of buildings. Link draws his sword; the screen goes blank. Sounds made would suggest that he is attacked harshly. Later, Link awakens on the ground, Sheik beside him. The fires have ceased. Sheik Looks like you're coming around... Link.... A terrible thing has happened! The evil shadow spirit has been released! Impa, the leader of Kakariko Village, had sealed the evil shadow spirit in the bottom of the well.... But the force of the evil spirit got so strong, the seal of the well broke, and it escaped into the world!! I believe Impa has gone to the Shadow Temple to seal it again, but...she will be in danger without any help! Link! Impa is one of the six Sages. Destroy the evil shadow spirit and save Impa! There is an entrance to the Shadow Temple beneath the graveyard behind this village. The only thing I can do for you is teach you the melody that will lead you to the Shadow Temple... This is the melody that will draw you into the infinite darkness that absorbs even time... Listen to this, the Nocturne of Shadow!!
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Nocturne of Shadow! <game> You have learned the Nocturne of Shadow! Sheik : Let me take care of the village! I'm counting on you, Link!
chapter.stage: Sheik disappears under the veil of a Deku Nut's light.

chapter.title: Social Script - Nighttime
chapter.sp: [ Buildings ] [CT-003] Wah hah hah hah hah hah! When times are tough, laughter is the best medicine! That's what my dad always said!

chapter.title: Windmill
chapter.sp: [KA-020] Grrrrrrrrr! I'll never forget what happened on that day, seven years ago! Grrrrrrrrr! It's all that Ocarina kid's fault! Next time he comes here, I'm gonna mess him up!
chapter.stage: Upon taking out the Ocarina of Time:
chapter.sp: [KA-020] What?! You've got an ocarina!! What the heck! That reminds me of that time, seven years ago! Back then a mean kid came here and played a strange song. It messed up this windmill! I'll never forget this song! <game> You've learned the Song of Storms!
chapter.stage: The Song of Storms creates a rainstorm within the windmill, and causes the central platform to rotate faster than it had before.
chapter.sp: [KA-020] Oh, no! A storm again!! You played the Ocarina again, didn't you!! Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!!
chapter.stage: In the past, upon playing the Song of Storms:
chapter.sp: As the windmill spins faster, the water's well is drained. [KA-020] Go around, go around, go around... What? It's going way too fast!

chapter.title: Bottom of the Well
chapter.stage: The Lens of Truth is located in the well, guarded by Dead Hand-- a somewhat-humanoid being with no apparent legs, which controls four long arms that protrude from the ground, aside from its regular arms with blade- like hands.

chapter.title: Graveyard
chapter.stage: The Nocturne of Shadow transports Link to a previously-inaccessible area. A descending staircase leads to a room with one door on which an image of an eye is printed, and before which numerous torches surround a platform.

sp.character: By using Din's Fire to simultaneously light all of the torches, the door is prompted to slide out of the way. The doorway leads to

chapter.title: Shadow Temple
chapter.stage: Upon approaching certain walls, messages are displayed.
chapter.sp: Message 01 The Shadow will yield only to one with the eye of truth, handed down in Kakariko Village. Message 02 One who gains the eye of truth will be able to see what is hidden in the darkness. Message 03: Shadow Temple... Here is gathered Hyrule's bloody history of greed and hatred... Message 04: What is hidden in the darkness... Tricks full of ill will... You can't see the way forward...
chapter.stage: There is a deep chasm in the temple's second room, across which a statue of a large face has been fastened to a wall, along with two stone hands and a platform in the shape of a tongue. At the statue's mouth is a pathway, which is blocked via gate.
chapter.sp: Sign 01 Only one who has sacred feet can cross the valley of the dead.
chapter.stage: The Hover Boots are obtained by defeating a Dead Hand elsewhere in the temple.
In the room with the chasm, there is a statue of a bird.
chapter.sp: Statue Make my break face the skull of truth. The alternative is descent into the deep darkness.
chapter.stage: The statue must be rotated to face a certain skull atop a stick, which is the skull that does not disappear when viewed through the Lens of Truth.
Failure causes the floor around the statue--which is held by hinges-- to open, dropping Link into a pit. Success opens the gate across the chasm.
In a room with two rising and falling platforms, on the undersides of which there are spikes:
Sign 02: Only one with the eye of truth will find the stone umbrella that protects against the rain of blades.
The Lens of Truth reveals an alcove housing a large stone block.
A hole in one room's floor leads Link to a circular chamber with a bongo- like platform, which is surrounded by toxic fluid.

The bongo-esque platform is beat by two large, disembodied hands. The hands belong to "Phantom Shadow Beast: Bongo Bongo", which takes the form of the upper body of a humanoid figure, though it possesses only one eye. Upon its defeat, Bongo Bongo dissolves into the bongo. A circle of light appears, which teleports Link to

chapter.title: Chamber of the Sages
chapter.stage: Impa appears before Link.
chapter.sp: Impa The boy with the noble Zelda's Ocarina...As I expected, you have come. I am Impa, one of the Sheikah. I am Princess Zelda's caretaker, and I am also the Sage who guards the Shadow Temple. We Sheikah have served the royalty of Hyrule from generation to generation as attendants. However... On that day seven years ago, Ganondorf suddenly attacked...and Hyrule Castle surrendered after a short time. Ganondorf's target was one of the keys to the Sacred Realm...the hidden treasure of the Royal Family...The Ocarina of Time! My duty bound me to take Zelda out of Ganondorf's reach. When last I saw you, as we made our escape from the castle, you were just a lad... Now I see that you have become a fine hero... There's nothing to worry about... The Princess is safe now. Soon, you'll meet Princess Zelda face-to-face, and she will explain everything... That is when we, the Six Wise Ones, will seal up the Evil King and return peace to Hyrule. I have to stay here... You go to Princess Zelda's side and protect her on my behalf. Now I put my power, which should be helpful to you, into this Medallion!
<game> You received the Shadow Medallion! Impa awakens as a Sage and adds her power to yours!
Impa Please look out for the Princess!

act.title: Gerudo Valley/Fortress

chapter.title: Gerudo Valley - Past
chapter.stage: A single bridge connects the two sides of the valley. Below the bridge is a river that connects to Lake Hylia, fed by a waterfall at the end of a stream flowing from Zora's Domain.
chapter.sp: One side of the bridge is blocked by a gate, near which a Gerudo is present. Gerudo 1 The Gerudo's Fortress is located beyond this gate. A kid like you has no business there.
chapter.stage: Another Gerudo is present near the bottom of the waterfall, by a cow.
chapter.sp: Gerudo 2 Why did you come all the way down here? What? You were just about to ask me the same thing? Well, now that you're down here, you may as well make the best of things!

chapter.title: Gerudo Valley - Future
chapter.stage: The bridge across the valley is currently broken. Epona and the Longshot are both viable methods of crossing.
chapter.sp: Sign 01 No Diving Allowed --It won't do you any good! Crptr Boss I am a master craftsman. Those Gerudo thieves...they broke the bridge. I want to fix it, but all of my workers are gone! They said working as carpenters isn't cool, and they went to the Gerudo's Fortress to become thieves... Hey, you! If you're going to the fortress, would you mind finding out what my workers are doing over there?
chapter.stage: A man who had run about Hyrule Field in the past (see 03'04) is present inside of a tent.
chapter.sp: RunningMan I'm the wandering running man! I've run all over this land in search of competitors who have a true killer instinct! I came here to run through the Haunted Wasteland, but it doesn't look like good timing for that. Though I want to go back to Hyrule Field, the bridge is...well, you can see it from here. So I'm stuck here, inside this tent. I don't think I can accept your challenge right now. Heh heh!

chapter.title: Gerudo's Fortress
chapter.stage: If Link is spotted by any of the fortress's many guards:
chapter.sp: Guard Halt! Stay where you are!
chapter.stage: He is deposited in a jail.
chapter.sp: Guard Stupid Kid [sic]! Get in there and keep quiet!
chapter.stage: Fortress interior - Carpenters
The carpenters have each been placed into cells.
chapter.sp: Carpenters Hey, you! Young man, over there! Look over here, inside the cell! I have no idea where you come from, but you must have a lot of guts to make it past all the guards around here! All of my fellow carpenters are imprisoned somewhere in here. If you can get us out of here, we'll repay the favor somehow! But be careful! There's sure to be Gerudo guards somewhere around here.... Woo! Watch out!
chapter.stage: A Gerudo Thief appears.
chapter.sp: If Link is hit by a certain attack, he is imprisoned. Thief Don't take us so lightly!
chapter.stage: Upon the thief's defeat, she drops a Small Key and flees.
chapter.sp: 1st Saved Did you come here to save me? Oh, that's just swell! I'm <name> the carpenter. We were really interested in joining their all-female group, but they locked us up like this just because we're men! We don't care about the Gerudo anymore! They're so rude! Three of my fellows have also been captured, so please help them escape, too! 2nd Saved You're a cute kid! Thank you for coming to save me! I'm <name>, the carpenter. These women are so scary! I'd rather work as a carpenter. than join them! I can't wait to say good-bye to this place! Two of my buddies are still being held prisoner. Will you please get them out, too? 3rd Saved : Thanks, boy! You're fantastic! I'm <name>, the carpenter. Have you seen our boss, boy? He's probably worried about me! I have to get back to him immediately! One more of our workers is still a prisoner. Please save him! 4th Saved : I was afraid you were going to forget about me! Now I'm free! Thanks! I'm <name> the carpenter. For rescuing me, I'll tell you something interesting about the desert that I overheard the Gerudos talking about. They said, "In order to cross the Haunted Wasteland, you'll need the 'eye of truth.' The Colossus is on the far side of the wasteland..." OK, now I'm going back to my tent near Gerudo Valley, so, drop by sometime. You may find something helpful there! Byeee!
chapter.stage: As the final carpenter leaves, a Gerudo enters the room.
chapter.sp: Gerudo I've seen your fine work. To get past the guards here, you must have good thieving skills. I used to think that all men, besides the great Ganondorf, were useless...but now that I've seen you, I don't think so anymore! The exalted Nabooru, our leader, put me in charge of this fortress. Nabooru is the second-in-command to the great Ganondorf, King of the Gerudo Thieves. Her headquarters are in the Spirit Temple, which is at the end of the desert. Say, you must want to become one of us, eh? All right, then! You're in from now on! Take this. With it, you will have free access to all areas of the fortress.
<game> You obtained the Gerudo's Membership Card! You can get into the Gerudo's training ground in their hideout.
Gerudo From now on, you're free to come and go as you please through the gate to the desert. You'll find the Spirit Temple, where the exalted Nabooru lives, out there in the desert.

act.chapter: Social Script [ Gerudo Valley ] The bridge has been repaired. Crptr Boss Hey, I heard you saved my men. When they returned, we built this bridge. Look at this! Isn't it a fine bridge? They may be wimpy carpenters, but once they all got together, they got the job done. Jiro In Gerudo society, those who have great skill in horseback riding and archery are well respected. How about trying horseback archery at the Gerudo's Fortress? If you have a horse, a Gerudo from the fortress will set up your challenge. Sabooru : When Nabooru was a lone wolf thief, she never stole from the weak, but... Now, Nabooru's gang of thieves stands for cruelty and brutality. She claims to be a chivalrous robber, but...no way! Ichiro : The leader of the gang of thieves is Nabooru. She is experimenting in brainwashing many people at the ruins in the desert. Shiro : Building a bridge over the valley is a simple task for four carpenters. When speaking to RunningMan, when the timer for another event is active: RunningMan Heh heh. You're already in the middle of something, aren't you. If you want to challenge me, you have to come here with a clear mind. No other distractions! When speaking to RunningMan, when no timers are active: RunningMan I'm the wandering running man! I've run all over this land in search of true competitve spirit. I beat all my challengers, man and beast. You're an athletic guy, and you look like you have have a true killer instinct, too. Now that the bridge over Gerudo Valley is complete, I'm looking for a challenger to have a commemorative race against. The best time to go from here to the bridge in the Lost Woods was 02"38". That's my record. Will you challenge my record? (Yes) Excellent! Then... You go first. I'll give you a headstart. Now! Go ahead. When speaking to him inside of the tent: Heh heh heh. Please. Go ahead. Upon playing warp music on the ocarina: Oh, looks like you quit the race. Heh heh heh. I bet you had almost rediscovered your killer instinct! At the Lost Woods, having not beat his record: Heh heh. You don't have enough killer instinct yet. Just train harder. Good-bye, then! At the Lost Woods, having beat his record: Huff...puff...huff... Huff...huff...whew! You did quite well! But you couldn't beat me! Your time was <"">, but I just beat you by one second! Huff...huff... You'll have to challenge me again sometime! Huff...huff... Good-bye, then! In the tent (the first paragraph is omitted if his original record was not beaten): Well, not perfect, but you have some guts! Unfortunately, you never can beat me. Your record is a thing of the past. Your time was <"">, wasn't it? That was close, but I beat you by one second! The best time to go from here to the bridge in the Lost Woods was <"">. That's my record. Will you challenge my record? - (No) Heh heh heh. You'll never discover your killer instinct with that kind of attitude. [ Gerudo's Fortress ] Sign 01 Gerudo Training Ground Only registered members are allowed! Sign 02 Horseback Archery Range Skilled players are welcome! Current record <> Points Sign 03 : Haunted Wasteland If you chase a mirage, the desert will swallow you. Only one path is true! Gerudos : From now on, you're free to come and go as you please through the gate to the desert. You'll find the Spirit Temple, where the exalted Nabooru lives, out there in the desert. [001] : Hey, newcomer! [002] : Hey, newcomer! [003] : Hey, newcomer! This is our horseback archery field. After a lot of hard practice and training, we finally have the skill to hit the bull's-eye while riding like the wind! When you finally learn how to ride a horse, you should come back and try it. It's a dangerous sport, but it's fun! While riding Epona: Hey newcomer, you have a fine horse! I don't know where you stole it from, but... OK, how about challenging this horseback archery? Once the horse starts galloping, shoot the targets with your arrows. Let's see how many points you can score. You get 20 arrows. If you can score 1,000 points, I will give you something good! Do you want to try for 20 Rupees? (Yes) You don't have enough Rupees! If less than 1,000 points are scored: <> points...Hmm... Wha-ha-ha! You have plenty of room for improvement! Do you want to try for 20 Rupees? If 1,000 or more points are scored: Fantastic! You are a true master! I will give this to you. Keep improving yourself! She provides a Piece of Heart. - (No) Nothing more is said. After having earned the Piece of Heart: Hey, rookie! You're looking good! Show me your skill again! You should set a new goal of 1,500 points and try again! Do you want to try for 20 Rupees? (Yes) If less than 1,000 points are scored: <> points...Hmm... Wha-ha-ha! You have plenty of room for improvement! Do you want to try for 20 Rupees? If 1,000-1,499 points are scored: <> points... Quite impressive! Do you want to try for 20 Rupees? If 1,500 or more points are scored: I'll be darned! You are the ultimate master! I will give you an item suitable for the master. This quiver is very important to me. I want you to have it. Take good care of it, OK? She provides a quiver upgrade. - (No) Nothing more is said. [004] : This is the Gerudo's Training Ground. Membership card verified. One try for 10 Rupees! Nothing is said in response to "Don't try". "Try" prompts: You don't have enough Rupees! Come back again! All right. I'll take your 10 Rupees. Give it your best shot! [ Gerudo Training Ground ] The {}-enclosed numbers correspond to rooms. The Gerudo is not seen. Gerudo {01} If you can overcome the trials in the chambers ahead, then and only then will you be qualified to hold our secret treasure! {02} Defeat all the enemies in a limited time! {03} Gather the jewels of white, while avoiding traps and danger! {04} Without the necessary items, one will be confouded by impossible mysteries. One with silver hands shall move a giant block! {05} Blind the eyes of the statue! {06} Find a secret passage in this room! {07} Cross the sea of fire! {08} Collect the underwater gems! {09} Defeat all the enemies in a limited time! {10} If you desire to acquire our hidden treasure, you must strive to obtain the keys hidden in each chamber! The treasure is the Ice Arrow.

chapter.title: Gerudo's Fortress
chapter.stage: By the entrance to the desert:
chapter.sp: [005] Hey, rookie! Are you going into the desert? I'll open this gate for you, but... You can't cross the desert unless you pass the two trials. The first trial is...the River of Sand! You can't walk across this river! After you cross it, follow the flags we placed there. The second trial is...the Phantom Guide! Those without eyes that can see the truth will only find themselves returning here. You are going anyway, aren't you? I won't stop you... Go ahead!

act.title: Haunted Wasteland
act.sp: Sign 01 All those reckless enough to venture into the desert-- please drop by our shop.
act.chapter: Carpet Merchant* - A man sits atop a flying carpet, which hovers over a pit of quick sand. Merchant Well Come [sic]! I am selling stuff, strange and rare, from all over the world to everybody. Today's special is... A dangerous, running object! Terrifying! I won't tell you what it is until I see the money... How about 200 Rupees? (Buy) Ohh, not enough Rupees. No discounts, even a Rupee. With sufficient funds: Thank you very much! What I'm selling is...Bombchu! The mark that will lead you to the Spirit Temple is the flag on the left outside the shop. Be seeing you! (Don't buy) Oh, that's too bad. The mark that will lead you to the Spirit Temple is the flag on the left outside the shop. If you change your mind, please come back again! A small building in the desert is surrounded by flags. On the roof, there is a stone platform on which words have been written. Writing One with the eye of truth shall be guided to the Spirit Temple by an inviting ghost. The Lens of Truth reveals a Poe floating above the building. Poe I'll be your guide on the way, but coming back, I won't play! I'll show you the only way to go, so follow me and don't be slow! The Poe leads Link to:

chapter.title: Desert Colossus - Future
chapter.stage: Part of a mountain has been carved into the likeness of Nabooru's image. The interior of the mountain has been made into the Spirit Temple.
chapter.sp: Little can be done in the temple at the moment; one passage is too small for Link to crawl through it, and the other pathway is obstructed by a block which is too heavy for Link to move. There is writing on two statues of cobras. Writing 01 If you want to proceed to the past, you should return here with the pure heart of a child. Writing 02 If you want to travel to the future, you should return here with the power of silver from the past.
chapter.stage: Upon exiting the temple, Sheik jumps down from a tall stone structure.
chapter.sp: Sheik Past, present, future...
chapter.stage: Kaepora Gaebora flies overhead.
chapter.sp: Sheik The Master Sword is a ship with which you can sail upstream and downstream through time's river... The port for that ship is in the Temple of Time... To restore the Desert Colossus and enter the Spirit Temple, you must travel back through time's flow... Listen to this Requiem of Spirit... This melody will lead a child back to the desert.
chapter.stage: Sheik readies a harp.
chapter.sp: Sheik Play the Requiem of Spirit!
chapter.stage: Perched atop a ledge, Gaebora observes. He departs as Link finishes playing the music.
chapter.sp: <game> You have learned the Requiem of Spirit!
chapter.stage: Link tries to approach Sheik, but a sandstorm begins, so he shields his eyes with a hand. Sheik disappears before the storm can subside.

act.chapter: Desert Colossus - Past Nabooru is standing by the small hole. Nabooru I haven't seen you around, kid... What do you want? (To see the temple) Nabooru You're just a kid! The temple is no place for kids! (Looking for the Sages) Nabooru A Sage? I don't know anyone like that. (Nothing, really) Nabooru You have nothing to do? What good timing! Can you do me a favor, kid? Wait a second, I want to ask you first--you wouldn't happen to be one of Ganondorf's...followers...would you? -(What if I am?) Nabooru Wha-ha-ha! Don't try to act cool, kid. I was just asking! A kid like you could never be one of Ganondorf's followers! Well, let's cut to the chase... -(I hate Ganondorf!) Nabooru Uh-huh! You've got guts. I think I like you. After either of the options following "Nothing, really": Nabooru First of all, let me introduce myself. I'm Nabooru of the Gerudos. I'm a lone wolf thief. But don't get me wrong! Though we're both thieves, I'm completely different from Ganondorf. With his followers, he stole from women and children, and he even killed people! A kid like you may not know this, but the Gerudo race consists only of women. Only one man is born every hundred years... Even though our laws say that lone male Gerudo must become King of the Gerudos, I'll never bow to such an evil man! By the way, what is your name, kid? Link?! What kind of name is that? Well...anyway... I want to ask you a favor... Will you go through this tiny hole and get a treasure that's inside? The treasure is the Silver Gauntlets. If you equip them, you can easily push and pull very heavy things! No, no, no, kid! Don't even think about taking this treasure for yourself! The Silver Gauntlets won't fit a little kid like you if you try to equip them! I want you to be a good boy and give them to me! Ganondorf and his minions are using the Spirit Temple as a hideout. Only the Silver Gauntlets will allow me to sneak deep into the temple. Once there, I'm going to steal all the treasure inside and mess up their plans! How about it? Will you do it? (Yes) Nabooru Thanks, kid! You and I, let's give Ganondorf and his followers a big surprise, shall we? If you can successfully get the Silver Gauntlets... I'll do something great for you! - (No) Nabooru Well, what did I expect? After all, you're just a kid! When speaking to her again, she repeats from "I want to ask you a favor". In a certain room, a message is displayed upon examining a sun-like object with a face painted onto it. Sun Show me the light! A Bombchu must be used to destroy a rock on a wall, which is blocking sunlight. When light touches the sun, it opens its eyes and smiles, prompting a door to open. Link eventually reaches the right hand of the colossus. Gaebora Hey, what's up, Link? Surprised to see me? A long time in this world is almost nothing to you, is it? How mysterious! Even I thought that the tales of a boy who could travel back and forth through time was [sic] merely a legend. Link, you have fully matured as an adult. From now on, the future of all the people in Hyrule is on your shoulders. Maybe it's not my time anymore. Here is my last advice. Two witches inhabit this temple. In order to destroy them, turn their own magic power against them. Hoo hoot! Do you want to hear what I said again? "Yes" prompts him to repeat himself from "From now on". "No" prompts:Gaebora : I will continue to watch you... Hoo hoo hoo hoot! He departs. On the ledge, there is a treasure chest containing the Silver Gauntlets. <game> You found the Silver Gauntlets! If you wore them, you would feel the power in your arms, the power to lift big things with {A}! But, these gauntlets won't fit a kid... Plus, you promised to give them to Nabooru. You should keep your word... Nabooru Hey! Where are you taking me?! Yeearggh! Let me go!! Link looks down at the entrance to the temple, where two aged witches have created a circle of purple light--which acts as quick sand--beneath Nabooru. Nabooru You, you fiends! Ganondorf's minions! Link! Get out of here! Now! These witches! They're using black magic on me! With Nabooru pulled entirely through the light, the witches fly into the temple atop their broomsticks.

chapter.title: Desert Colossus - Future
chapter.stage: With the Silver Gauntlets, Link can now move the heavy stone block.

After some time, Link encounters the two witches, who are accompanied by an Iron Knuckle of atypical design. The witch named "Kotake" has a blue jewel on her forehead, while Koume's forehead bears an orange jewel.
chapter.sp: Kotake Ho ho ho! Looks like someone is here, Koume. Koume Hee hee hee! Looks like it, Kotake! Kotake : What an outrageous fellow he is, to intrude so boldly into our temple... Ho ho ho! Koume : We should teach this outrageous fellow a lesson! Hee hee hee! Oh, loyal minion... Destroy this intruder on our behalf!
chapter.stage: They disappear.
chapter.sp: The Iron Knuckle stands from the throne on which it had sat, and raises its hands. The battle music abruptly stops as the enemy realizes that its hands are empty. To remedy this, it snaps its fingers, causing a giant double- sided axe to materialize from thin air. Upon the enemy's defeat, its armor falls off--revealing Nabooru. Nabooru Unnnh... Where am I...?
chapter.stage: Koume and Kotake reappear.
chapter.sp: Kotake Well, well... Looks like she's back to normal... Koume... Koume She's just a little girl, but she commands a lot of respect among te Gerudo, Kotake... Kotake : Maybe we should make we work for the great Ganondorf for a little while longer! Ho ho ho! Koume : Then we should brainwash her again! Hee hee hee!
chapter.stage: They launch magic at Nabooru, which teleports her out of the area. The witches disappear again.
In a nearby room, upon climbing onto a high platform:
chapter.sp: ??? Look at that stupid kid! He came on his own to offer himself as a sacrifice to the great Ganondorf...
chapter.stage: Circles of fire and ice appear, from which Koume and Kotake respectively materialize.
chapter.sp: Koume With my flame, I will burn him to the bone! Kotake With my frost, I will freeze him to his soul!
chapter.stage: The "Sorceress Sisters: Twinrova" circle about Link in the air.

sp.sp: Koume OK, let's get serious now, Kotake! Kotake : Oh, OK, Koume. <both> : Kotake and Koume's Double Dynamite Attack!

chapter.stage: They fuse into a single entity--Twinrova--with hair made of fire and ice, holding two staves that correspond to an element. Twinrova winks at Link.
chapter.sp: Upon Twinrova's defeat, Koume and Kotake separate. Koume Shoot, what a fresh kid! This time, we'll get serious, right Kotake?
chapter.stage: Halos appear above their heads, and a beam of light shoots down.
chapter.sp: Kotake What? Hey, Koume, what is that above your head? Koume I don't know, but you have one over your head too, Kotake!
chapter.stage: They both briefly pause.
chapter.sp: Koume But I'm only 400 years old! Kotake And I'm just 380 years old! Koume : We're twins! Don't try to lie about your age! Kotake : You must have gone senile! Koume : Who are you calling senile?! Is that how you treat your older sister? Kotake : We are twins! How can you be older! Koume : Keeeyaaah!! How heartless you are! Kotake : How can you be so ungrateful? Koume : You're heartless!! Kotake : You ungrateful...
chapter.stage: They both settle down as they are pulled into the light.
chapter.sp: <both> I'll come back to haunt you!
chapter.stage: A circle of light appears on a platform. It takes Link to:

chapter.title: Chamber of the Sages
chapter.stage: Nabooru appears before Link.
chapter.sp: Nabooru Kid, let me thank you. Heheheh...look what the little kid has become in the past seven years--a competent swordsman! By the way... I really messed up... I was brainwashed by those old witches and used by Ganondorf to do his evil will... But isn't it funny? That a person like me could turn out to be the Sage of Spirit! And now, I'm going to fight them as one of the six Sages! Heh heh... I'm going to pay them back for what they did to me! Kid... No... Link, the Hero of Time! Instead of keeping the promise I made back then, I give you this Medallion! Take it!
<game> You received the Spirit Medallion! Nabooru awakens as a Sage and adds her power to yours!
Nabooru : If only I knew you would become such a handsome man... I should have kept the promise I made back then...
